page.title: 16HEN HOUSE (GOLLANFIELD)
page.content: At{Gollanfield,}next to{Loch {Flemington}there are some{Battery Hen {Houses.}My friend's father works there First they take the chicks in when they are very young,and they keep them there for quite a long time until they have grown and fattened up. Then a lorry comes and takes them away. Then they clean out the sheds and take in new chicks. Since the chickens need to be kept warm they have very big heating fans. The chicken houses were built in {1964.}There are{37,500 chickens}there at the moment.Sometimes they get them for their eggs.They feed the very young chicks on{chick starter {crumbs,}when they are under six weeks Then when they are six to eighteen weeks old they give them {pullet grower crumbs.}At last they get sold to various laying farms.
